The Greens remain committed today, as always, to peace and non-violence. 

Lest we forget.

If Parliament had to approve sending troops to war instead of just leaving it up to government, our country might be more committed to finding other ways of solving conflicts. And with a dangerous demagogue running the US, now more than ever we need an independent foreign policy.

The Greens support those who lay their lives on the line for our country, even if we often disagree with politicians' decisions to send them to war.

As we support those who serve, the Greens will keep fighting for an end to militarism and war.

For me, today remains an occasion to reflect and remember all those affected by war, including our recent wars, whether they died in service, returned home and lived with the trauma, or were loved ones who carried the burden.
Both my grandfathers served and this morning was also a quiet time to mark the contribution made by people like them in other wars, like the war against fascism in WWII.

It reinforces the need to fight for a world free from violence and to cast a critical eye on politicians who use war to win votes or aggressively expand their empires, because many people end up paying the ultimate price.

For me, reflecting on World War I is important, for it remains an event of large-scale slaughter where many people were needlessly sent to their deaths by politicians, including young people from Australia.

COVID-19 has meant we are unable to gather as a community to commemorate ANZAC Day as usual. Am v glad, however, gov is finally acting on wage subsidies. It was always a missing part of the package & we pushed for it from start. This is a big step for everyone demanding jobs & wages guarantees. Just like we fought for students & renters, Greens will push to fix this too.

To start reversing the massive job losses we’re seeing, the wage guarantee must be at least 80% of wages. Otherwise, employers won’t have the incentive to rehire many of their workers, especially if their turnover is down, because it won’t make financial sense to do so.
